intro: Acostaea costaricensis subsp. bicornis, commonly known as the bicornuate acostaea, is a rare fern species native to Central America. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, bifurcated fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Its leaves are pinnately divided and often have a leathery texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
